beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Kettle Mettle? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Kettle Mettle scored 53 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Kettle Mettle. British Columbia, Canada. 80 mi. BC mountain gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Kettle Mettle | British Columbia, Canada | 80 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. The 100km option hits the sweet spot for most gravel riders, with 25km and 50km alternatives for beginners. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. Built on railway grades with maximum 2. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. The 7000ft over 80 miles provides steady climbing without brutal pitches, thanks to the historic railway grade design. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Historical weather data shows average highs of 65°F and lows of 44°F, with a 56% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Well-run race. Professional touches throughout. Justin Payeur confirms the events are "well organized and great people turn out," with multiple aid stations and mechanical support positioned strategically along the route. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Rolling through "wildflower-blanketed canyons" and shaded railway tunnels while overlooking Okanagan wineries delivers memorable scenery. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Post-race gatherings feature local wines and beer where "cyclists gathered at the finish line to share stories, swap tales of their journey.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Negligible altitude effect. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast.
